image.altText: Macquarie Point render, Gate 1 night

props.synopsis: The long-running debate over whether an AFL stadium should be built on Hobart's waterfront is reaching an end, as the parliamentary vote takes place this week.

title.children: What to expect as decision day on Macquarie Point stadium finally arrives

image.altText: two women holding up a placard reading 'yes' stadium

props.synopsis: Supporters of Tasmania's proposed AFL stadium have gathered on Hobart's parliament lawns on Sunday to show their backing of the controversial build.

title.children: 'Now or never': Pro-stadium rally gathers ahead of crucial parliament vote

image.altText: a man in a shirt and jumper up close to a microphone

props.synopsis: Premier Jeremy Rockliff is asked whether the government can improve health services and fund a new stadium at Hobart's Macquarie Point, ahead of the final vote in parliament this week.

image.altText: A teen boy with thin moustache.

props.synopsis: Local King Island teen Lusian West, 16, has not been seen since Friday, with Tasmania police and rescue crews to conduct aerial searches of the island's north.

title.children: King Island teen missing since Friday, police say

image.altText: A young girl walks across granite rocks covered in orange algae by the beach.

props.synopsis: Twenty years ago, Cape Barren Island was handed back to its traditional owners. Today's children are proof of the life-changing power of that act.

title.children: From capping rent to burying the dead, Cape Barren Island governs itself

image.altText: An aerial view of poweer station with two large smoke stacks.

props.synopsis: The energy grid is not ready for the closure of the Eraring coal plant, the energy operator has warned, raising the threat of widespread blackouts in eastern Australia.

title.children: Energy grid not ready for Eraring coal plant's closure, AEMO says

props.synopsis: At least 212 people are dead and 218 are missing in Sri Lanka as floods, cyclones and torrential rain continue to affect millions of people across Asia.

title.children: Death toll tops 800 as intense storms hammer Asian countries

image.altText: Back of the head of a senior man, gray hair looking at tv in his lounge, black screen on the tv.

props.synopsis: About 50,000 Australians are set to lose access to free-to-air television over their existing technology. And the troubles don't end there, with many customers also reporting regular and prolonged internet outages.

title.children: Thousands of Australians losing free-to-air TV access, facing internet issues

image.altText: A middle aged woman with curly grey hair in a brown jacket in a tv studio

props.synopsis: The early childhood education minister is refusing to say whether the federal government will establish an independent review of childcare standards.

title.children: Minister won't commit to independent review amid childcare sector scrutiny

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese with his wife, Jodie Haydon.

props.synopsis: It is hard to imagine a better end to the prime minister's year than this one, but realists in government know Labor can't continue to ride the wave.

title.children: Albanese and Labor are at their zenith. What a difference a year makes

image.altText: Salad harvester at work at sunrise.

image.altText: Pope Leo XIV blesses a child while standing among a group in front of a plane.

props.synopsis: As Pope Leo visits Lebanon, many locals hope he will bring peace to the region, viewing the visit as a message of solidarity.

title.children: Lebanese hope pope's visit will dissuade Israel from further strikes

image.altText: Four young girls smile while holding a brown Labrador dog on the grass.

props.synopsis: Dogs were banned some years ago to protect the unique wildlife of Christmas Island, but one very special chocolate labrador remains, and she is shared by the whole community.

title.children: Meet Shiloh, the last dog on Christmas Island

image.altText: A newsreader with a digital mask over her face.

props.synopsis: With AI deepfakes causing confusion and harm online, the federal government tells tech developers that AI content should be clearly labelled, ahead of a National AI Plan due to be released.Â

title.children: Tech companies advised to label AI-generated content

image.altText: Generic image of a phone displaying a folder of social media apps.

props.synopsis: As the social media ban comes into effect, experts are worried children and families will be left vulnerable to age verification scams. Here's why.Â

title.children: Social media ban leaves children vulnerable to phishing scams, experts say

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

image.altText: Southport light rail tracks at sunset generic tram 4

props.synopsis: With the population heading toward 1 million, the Gold Coast is being urged to overhaul its transport system or risk becoming defined by traffic.

title.children: Gold Coast urged to curb car dependence after light rail loss

image.altText: England cricket team walk out

props.synopsis: Australia's Ashes domination in Brisbane is almost total, with England winless at the Gabba since 1986. It wasn't always like this though, with the first visit to Brisbane resulting in the heaviest defeat in cricket history.

title.children: When England won an Ashes by 675 runs to crowd's 'horror and amazement'

image.altText: Travis Head raises his bat as he leaves the field in the first Ashes Test in Perth.

props.synopsis: Travis Head says he has no qualms if he is shifted back down Australia's batting order following his exploits as an opener in the first Ashes Test.

title.children: Head happy to 'play any role' in day-night Ashes Test

image.altText: A backyard with childrens' toys flooded

props.synopsis: Runoff from heavy rainfall and poor drainage can cause damage to properties and worsen flooding. So, who's responsible if your property experiences runoff, and what can you do about it?

title.children: Who's responsible when stormwater flows onto your property?

image.altText: Officers carrying a body in a white sheet with a burnt building complex in the background

props.synopsis: The death toll in the Hong Kong blaze rises as authorities say another 100 people remain unaccounted-for.

title.children: Death toll in Hong Kong blaze rises to 146 after more bodies found

image.altText: Two men in the pub, one is Wayde Chiesa, one is David Crisafulli

props.synopsis: A week is a long time in politics, let alone three years, and the LNP's success at the next election is by no means assured, writes Jack McKay.

title.children: Hinchinbrook by-election result no crystal ball for LNP government's future

image.altText: An underwater shot in a water-filled cave, with rocks formations

title.children: 65yo Victorian diver drowns at Tank Cave near Mount Gambier

image.altText: Sydney student accommodation Sharesorted 2025-11-28

props.synopsis: International students relying on education agents to study in Australia might be misled about the country's housing situation.

title.children: 'Unjust': International students trading their rights for a bed

image.altText: Two people are suspended on the side of a large coal ship holding a banner which reads "phase out coal and gas".

props.synopsis: Police arrest 141 people in Newcastle Harbour for alleged marine-related offences during an anti-fossil fuel protest that began on Thursday.Â

title.children: Protesters arrested for blocking world's largest coal export port

image.altText: WA premier Roger Cook speaks while wearing a white checked shirt with no tie.

props.synopsis: The WA government commits $14.8 million towards family and domestic violence refuges across the state, with one provider saying it will help support women facing "life and death" situations.

title.children: WA government pledges $14.8m for domestic violence refuges across state

image.altText: A woman wearing a black blazer stands with her hands in front of her

props.synopsis: Hayley Brown says she almost lost her life at the hands of a long-term partner. She is now one of the first victim-survivors to join a statewide lived experience advisory network.

title.children: Domestic violence survivor shares 'failures in the system' to spark change

image.altText: a crashed light plane aircraft in the bushes after a mid air collision in wedderburn

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to Napper Field, in Wedderburn about 11:50am on Sunday following reports of a crash.

title.children: Pilot dead after light aircraft collide mid-air

image.altText: People march past a Melbourne tram stop at the Put Australia First rally.

props.synopsis: A large police presence, including riot police, was stationed across Melbourne's CBD as two countering protest groups marched through the city.

title.children: Anti-immigration protest met with counter-rally in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: Flames and thick smoke rise from a tanker in the black sea

props.synopsis: Naval drones could be seen speeding towards hulking tankers followed by powerful explosions that caused fires on the vessels.

title.children: Ukraine attacks two Russian 'shadow fleet' oil tankers in the Black Sea
